ui

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • ui.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class World
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The playground for the vacuum cleaner, extends a JPANEL. This class keeps track of what tile is what and draws the objects. It also starts the agents and has a run function that makes the bot run until the simulation is complete (the area is cleaned or steps == 0)
    Author:
    Hauken
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int rows,
             int columns,
             int dustParticles,
             int objects,
             javax.swing.JLabel lbl,
             boolean dustRespawn,
             boolean strictMovement,
             boolean rememberObject,
             javax.swing.JLabel crashLbl,
             javax.swing.JLabel dustRmnLabel,
             int eastChance,
             int westChance,
             int forwardChance)
        Constructor. Adds all the tiles corresponding to number of rows/columns
        Parameters:
        rows - how many rows in the grid
        columns - how many columns in the grid
        dustParticles - how many dust particales
        objects - how many objects, excluding the border
        lbl - label used to decrement steps in the GUI
        dustRespawn - true/false depending on dust should respawn or not
        strictMovement - true/false depending on there should be no random movement
        rememberObject - true/false depending on if the agent should remember crashlocations
        crashLbl - label to show number of crashes
        dustRmnLabel - label to show number of dust particles remaining
        eastChance - chance for the agent to turn east, chosen by user
        westChance - chance for the agent to turn west, chosen by user
        forwardChance - chance for the agent to turn forward, chosen by uyser

        public void simStopped()
        Method that stops the simulation

      • checkSimulationStatus

        public boolean checkSimulationStatus()
        Method that check if the simulation is running
        Returns:
        true/false depending on if the simulation is running or not

      • start

        public void start()
        Method that starts the simulation and keeps it running until the simulation is complete or the simulation is stopped.

      • checkTile

        public int checkTile(int nX,
                     int nY,
                     int loc,
                     int cDir)
        Method that iterates through each tile until it find the next tile in the direction of the robot. Depending on what tile it is, it does some actions
        Parameters:
        nX - the x coordinate of the next tile
        nY - the y coordinate of the next tile
        loc - the location/position of the tile in the array
        cDir - the direction of the robot
        Returns:
        a number which decides what the robot should do

      • respawningDust

        public void respawningDust()
        Method that respawns dust. Should not spawn on other dust tiles and object tiles. Dust should only spawn on tiles that had dust earlier.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
